text: Princeton Nurseries was a large commercial plant nursery near Kingston, New Jersey. Founded in 1913 by William Flemer Sr., it once was the largest commercial nursery in the United States. The company stopped operations here in 1995. It was added to the National Register of Historic Places as the Princeton Nurseries Historic District on August 28, 2018. ==Horticultural introductions== * Ulmus americana 'Princeton' – 'Princeton' American Elm ==Gallery== File:Princeton Nurseries, Middlesex County, NJ - Storage Building.jpg|Storage Building File:Princeton Nurseries, Middlesex County, NJ - Propagation House.jpg|Progagation House File:Princeton Nurseries, Middlesex County, NJ - Propagation House and Greenhouse.jpg|Propagation House and Greenhouse File:Princeton Nurseries, Middlesex County, NJ - Flemer Arboretum sign.jpg|Flemer Arboretum File:Princeton Nurseries, Middlesex County, NJ - Flemer Arboretum, flowering tree.jpg|Flowering tree in the arboretum ==See also== * Washington Road Elm Allée ==References== ==External links== * * Category:Plainsboro Township, New Jersey Category:South Brunswick, New Jersey Category:National Register of Historic Places in Middlesex County, New Jersey Category:Historic districts on the National Register of Historic Places in New Jersey Category:New Jersey Register of Historic Places Category:1913 establishments in New Jersey Category:Plant nurseries Category:Arboreta in New Jersey
title: Princeton Nurseries
